author: Raymond C.

review: This is a nicely packaged little gadget - not unlike the many other options out there (Apple TV, Roku, etc..). I also have two Apple TV's and wanted to see how the Amazon Fire TV compared.As many reviews have noted, it's super easy and quick to set up and connect so that you're ready to go.After watching the tutorial guide I wanted to see what was available.This is where the major disappointment came in: I am not a PRIME member so it doesn't take long to realize that you have to pay for EVERYTHING.The remote is pretty well designed and easy to learn.The voice recognition feature seemed to work well - but I didn't try it extensively.Then I tried watching a trailer  - second disappointment: the dreaded "buffer wheel" made me exit out after two minutes. If I can't even watch a trailer without interruption, then I shudder to think what a movie would be like.Finally, I am not a gamer and no kids - so a LOT of content is of no interest for me.If I'm going to pay for content then I might as well stay with DISH and get PPV or VOD movies with a lot less hassle.If Amazon and others are touting this as the "future" and for cable and satellite cutters, I think the future is a long way off. If you have to pay for everything you very quickly reach the same cost as cable or satellite.I'm glad I got the refurb and saved a few bucks...I may still send it back for a refund.
